title: Represent and analyze - x and direction from v eqn

content.question: A block on a horizontal surface is connected to a horizontal spring, and the other end of the spring is fixed in place. The block is oscillating to the left and to the right as it moves with negligible friction on the surface. The velocity of the block as a function of time is <math alttext="v of t equals, v sub max, the cosine of, open parenthesis, omega t, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>v</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>max</mi></msub><mi>cos</mi><mtext> </mtext><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>ω</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="v sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></mstyle></math> is a positive constant and the positive direction is taken to be to the right. Which of the following correctly describes both the position and the direction of velocity of the block at time <math alttext="t equals the fraction pi over omega" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mi>ω</mi></mfrac></math> ?

choices.label: The block is passing through the equilibrium position while moving to the left.
The block is passing through the equilibrium position while moving to the right.
The block is at its maximum displacement to the left of the equilibrium position. It is instantaneously at rest, so there is no direction for the velocity.
The block is at its maximum displacement to the right of the equilibrium position. It is instantaneously at rest, so there is no direction for the velocity.

content.answer: The block is passing through the equilibrium position while moving to the left.
